intro: Julieta, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil. Julieta prefers full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
